StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The Environmental Determinants of Diabetes in the Young Study (TEDDY)

Person.Organization: H. LEE MOFFITT CANCER CTR & RES INSTUNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This research utilizes data obtained by the TEDDY study group, a collaborative clinical study sponsored by the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK), National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD), National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS), and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and JDRF. The data from the TEDDY study reported here were supplied by the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP), which is maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI). This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with investigators of the TEDDY study and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the TEDDY study, dbGaP, or the NIDDK.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Type 1 diabetes, its complications and other autoimmune diseases, IRB, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-T1DR-IRB-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Type 1 diabetes, its complications and other autoimmune diseases and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The Environmental Determinants of Diabetes in the Young Study (TEDDY)

Person.Organization: H. LEE MOFFITT CANCER CTR & RES INSTUNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The Environmental Determinants of Diabetes in the Young (TEDDY) study was conducted by Åke Lernmark, Ph.D. (Lund University, Malmo, Sweden), William Hagopian, MD, PhD (Pacific Northwest Diabetes Research Institute, Seattle, WA), Marian Rewers, MD, PhD (Barbara Davis Center for Childhood Diabetes, University of Colorado, Aurora, CO), Jin-Xiong She, PhD (Medical College of Georgia, Georgia Regents University, Augusta, GA), Olli Simell, MD, PhD (Turku University Hospital, Turku, Finland), Jorma Toppari, MD, PhD (University of Turku, Turku, Finland), Anette-G. Ziegler, MD (Helmholtz Zentrum München, and Klinikum rechts der Isar, Technische Universität München, and Forschergruppe Diabetes e.V., Neuherberg, Germany), Beena Akolkar, PhD (National Institute of Diabetes & Digestive & Kidney Diseases, Bethesda, MD), Jeffrey Krischer, PhD (University of South Florida, Tampa, FL) and supported by U01 DK63829, U01 DK63861, U01 DK63821, U01 DK63865, U01 DK63863, U01 DK63836, U01 DK63790, UC4 DK63829, UC4 DK63861, UC4 DK63821, UC4 DK63865, UC4 DK63863, UC4 DK63836, UC4 DK95300, and UC4 DK100238, and Contract No. HHSN267200700014C from the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK), National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID), National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD), National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS), Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF), and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). This work supported in part by the NIH/NCATS Clinical and Translational Science Awards to the University of Florida (UL1 TR000064) and the University of Colorado (UL1 TR001082). The data from the TEDDY study reported here were supplied by the Database of Genes and Phenotypes (dbGAP), which is maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI). This manuscript was not prepared in collaboration with Investigators of the TEDDY study and does not necessarily reflect the opinions or views of the TEDDY study, dbGAP, or the NIDDK.
